intro: Madia dissitiflora, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Its growth habit is typically low-growing, with a compact form that helps it conserve water. The species is well adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
